channel.title: DocuAPI Example Site
channel.description: Recent content on DocuAPI Example Site

item.title: API Reference
item.description: Introduction The PaySuper API is organized around REST. Our API is designed to have predictable, resource-oriented URLs and to use HTTP response codes to indicate API errors. We use built-in HTTP features, like HTTP verbs, which can be understood by off-the-shelf HTTP clients. JSON will be returned in all responses from the API, including errors. All API requests must be made over HTTPS. Authentication Authentication to the API occurs via Signature-based authentication.

item.title: PaySuper API Reference
item.description: Order You can create a payment order with details about your customer and sales option data. Statuses Name Description created Itâ€™s an initial state of the requested order but it is not processed in a payment system yet. The created order can become one of the statuses: processed, canceled, rejected. processed The order is successfully processed in the payment system. The processed order can become refunded or chargeback.
